intro: Pleiotaxis huillensis subsp. huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén pleiotaxis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound umbels and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, often at high altitudes. Its leaves are finely divided and can be used in traditional medicine by local communities. The species is noted for its ornamental value and ecological significance in its native environment.
